Course Description: The main aim of this elective course is to provide students a good background in Quantitative Biology and enabling them to implement various statistical methods in analyzing biological data and its visualization. The course will also provide basic introduction of applied biostatistics.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students develop skills to solve statistical problem related to biological queries
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students develop skills to summarise theoretical and quantitative concepts of Mendalian/non-Mendalians, GWAS, eQTl etc
Course Outcomes.CO3: Student develop skills to solve quantitative problem of population genetics

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Sampling methods and Sample size determination, Statistical Epidemiology
Longitudinal Data Analysis, Categorical Data Analysis
Time to event data analysis, Clinical Trials
Quantitative Genetics: Relationship between genotype and phenotype, Types of Quantitative Characteristics, Nilsson-Ehle’s cross
Determining Gene Number for a Polygenic Characteristic. Statistical Methods Required for Analyzing Quantitative Characteristics.
Phenotypic and Genotypic Variance, Calculating Heratibility. Locating Genes That Affect Quantitative Characteristics, Genomewide Association Studies.
Genetically Variable Traits Change in Response to Selection
Quantitative expect of Horizontal Gene Transfer
Hardy-Weinberg law, its implications and its extensions.
Estimation of Genomic or Allelic Frequencies with the Hardy-Weinberg Law
Quantitative aspect of Mendalian and non-mendalian Genetics

Resource Material.Textbook: B. Pierce, Genetics: A conceptual approach
Resource Material.Reference Book: Principles and Practice of Biostatistics - by B Antonisamy
